meanings.definition: A critical edition of the Old Testament in six versions.
meanings.sent1: The scholar studied the hexapla to understand the differences in the Old Testament versions.
meanings.sent2: The library had a rare hexapla that compared various Old Testament texts.
meanings.sent3: The hexapla on the shelf seemed to whisper secrets about ancient scriptures.
meanings.sent4: Her mind became a hexapla, filled with different interpretations of the same story.
meanings.sent5: The hexapla shone a light on the complexities of biblical translations.

meanings.definition: A manuscript containing six versions of the Old Testament.
meanings.sent1: The ancient hexapla was carefully preserved in the museum.
meanings.sent2: Scholars analyzed the hexapla to uncover the variations in Old Testament texts.
meanings.sent3: The hexapla manuscript was so old, it almost crumbled at a touch.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt like a hexapla, each version of the story competing for attention.
meanings.sent5: The hexapla revealed the evolution of language through different biblical texts.

meanings.definition: A work that compares six different versions of the Old Testament.
meanings.sent1: The hexapla provided a comprehensive comparison of Old Testament translations.
meanings.sent2: Students used the hexapla to explore the nuances of different Old Testament versions.
meanings.sent3: The hexapla work was so detailed, it felt like reading six books at once.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts swirled like a hexapla, each version adding a new layer of understanding.
meanings.sent5: The hexapla was a treasure trove of insights into biblical interpretation.
